org.apache.gearpump.streaming.dsl.partitioner

Class GroupByPartitioner<T,Group>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.gearpump.streaming.dsl.partitioner.GroupByPartitioner<T,Group>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Partitioner, UnicastPartitioner

    public class GroupByPartitioner<T,Group>
extends java.lang.Object
implements UnicastPartitioner
    Partition messages by applying group by function first.

    For example: 

    
 case class People(name: String, gender: String)

 object Test{

   val groupBy: (People => String) = people => people.gender
   val partitioner = GroupByPartitioner(groupBy)
 }

    param: fn First apply message with groupBy function, then pick the hashCode of the output to do the partitioning. You must define hashCode() for output type of groupBy function.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getPartition

        public int getPartition(Message message,
                        int partitionNum,
                        int currentPartitionId)
        Description copied from interface: UnicastPartitioner
        Gets the SINGLE downstream processor task index to send message to.

        Specified by:
        getPartition in interface UnicastPartitioner
        Parameters:
        message - Message you want to send
        partitionNum - How many tasks does the downstream processor have.
        currentPartitionId - Upstream task's task index who trigger the getPartition() call.

        Returns:
        ONE task index of downstream processor.
